chapter.title: Configuration and registration of IPS sensors
chapter.para: After installation, start the configuration process of the sensors. There are basically two parts: network configuration and registration in Horama (Managers). The registration of the sensors in the Manager involves completion of the installation process of the redBorder IPS solution in the appliance.
After automatic reboot, you will have access to the following screen:

listitem.para: Login
Password
Command rb_sysconf

chapter.para: This process is identical to that discussed in the completion process of the Installation Configuration Assistant Manager.
You can refer to this information in Chapter 3, Section 3.1. Finishing Installation Configuration Assistant Manager.
In this section there is a detailed explanation of the steps to follow to complete the process and launch the setup menu of the IPS sensors.

section.title: Setup Menu IPS sensors
section.para: Execute the command rb_sysconf to access the menu Setting redBorder.
This menu contains 5 options:

listitem.para: System Configuration:From this option you can define and modify some basic system settings such as name, hour, keyboard layout, etc.
Network Configuration: this is the option from which all the network settings for the proper installation of the solution are made.
Passwords: access this option if you want to change your passwords.
Backup System: make a backup of the configuration
Update rules from Manager: Select this option to force Download Manager rules. (Optional).
quit: Quit.

section.title: Steps for configuring IPS sensors
section.para: In order for the redBorder IPS solution to work properly, it is necessary to first put the sensors in the network.To do this, the user will have to perform the network configuration, selecting Network Configuration by inserting the number 2once you have accessed the redBorder configuration wizard.
Until you have done this configuration, you can not proceed with registration of the sensors in the Manager.
These are the steps to follow to install the IPS sensors:

listitem.para: Network Configuration Management:
a) Creation of bonding and assigning interface management.
b) Setting segments or network interfaces which are to be placed sensors.
DNS Settings and Domain Settings

note.title: Note
note.para: The order indicated in this installation manual is what is considered optimal.

warning.title: Caution
warning.para: If the system is installed on a real computer with more than one network card, the user must choose the bonding management.

section.title: Management Network Configuration: creation of bonding and assignment of interface management
section.para: Select the Network Configuration option by selecting 2 and pressing Enter.
If the system recognizes the interfaces with a bypass these will automatically be assigned to the segments.
Then the following actions will be taken to ensure that the network sensor is configured correctly:

listitem.para: Creating a bonding: (maximum 4 bonds).
Selecting and assigning ports to bonding.
Configuration interface management for bondings created.

section.para: For the selection of ports, a list will be displayed with detailed and valuable information, which will help the administrator to decide which ports to assign to the bonding.

section.title: Creating a new bonding and assignment of port
section.para: To illustrate this process you will create a bonding (bond0) and assign 2 ports.
Select the n option on the lateral submenu right of the screen.
Once you have reviewed the ports available, select the one you want to assign to bonding, as it appears at the bottom of the previous screen.
Enter the port number in the lineInsert bonding first port [0]: _
The number in brackets[] is what defines the system default. To select this number, press Enter.
The port selected option disappears from the available ports.

note.title: Note
note.para: The system only allows the creation of up to 4 bonds: (0-3).

section.title: Add a new port bonding
section.para: The system will ask the following: Insert second port (y/N):_
The option selected by default is capitalized. Remember that if you DO NOT want to add a new port just have to press the Enter key.
If you want to insert a new port, type y.
Enter the port number on the second lineInsert bonding second port [1]: _
The number in brackets [] is the defining default system. To select this number, press Enter.

section.title: Network configuration of bonding
section.para: Once you have made the assignment of the second port to the new bonding (bond0), the system will prompt you to enter the following data:

listitem.para: IP Address
Netmask
Gateway
Routes

section.para: If your computer uses DHCP, you will be assigned an IP address by default. Press Enter to select the IP, mask and gateway assigned by the system. Otherwise, manually enter these values.
The system also gives a default route for the bonding created.
To insert a path manually, select y in the line Insert a route for this bonding (y/N)?:_
Once this process has been finished a display message will appear that says Bonding 0 created successfully.

section.title: Finish the process of creating the bonding
section.para: Before applying changes and finalizing the process of creating the bonding, the system will display a table that contained the new bonding created (bond0) along with the ports that have been assigned, IP and Mask and manually assigned route or default.
In order for modifications to be saved, you must perform the action to implement changes by selecting a.
At any time you can delete the created bonds by selecting delete bonding entering the letter d.
To return to the main menu network configuration, select the quit option with the letter q.

section.title: Configuring DNS and domain settings
section.para: In the Network Configuration menu you will find options DNS and domain settings. To begin the process, select option 2.
To complete the settings correctly, the user must enter:

listitem.para: Domain Name
Primary DNS Address
Secondary DNS Address (optional)

section.para: After entering this information, the system will prompt that it has correctly applied this configuration.
To finish the process, it is not necessary to apply changes. To return to Network Settings in the main menu select option quit by entering the letter q.

section.title: Configuring network segments
section.para: In the Network Settings menu select the option Segment settings by entering the number 3.
This screen shows the number of segments that have been created, the ports assigned to each segment and if these have no support or bypass.
You will find the following submenu:

listitem.para: f) force bypass autoassign:force the automatic assignment of port with bypass.
n) new segment:select to create a new segment.
d) delete segment:delete a segment.
q) quit:exit

section.para: To begin creating a new segment select the option segment inserting the lettern.
The process of creating segments comprises the following actions:

listitem.para: Auto-assign interfaces to bypass segments (optional) type.
Creation of a segment: (maximum 16 segments).
Selection and assignment of ports to the segment.

section.para: For the selection of ports, a list will be displayed with detailed and valuable information, which will help the administrator to decide which segments will be created.

section.title: Assigning interfaces to bypass segments
section.para: If the system detects bypass interfaces, these are automatically assigned to segments when entering the menu Network Settings.
There are also two modes of assignment of ports or interfaces to bypass segments:

listitem.para: Forcing bypass auto-assign: select option Force bypass auto assign in the Segments Setting menu, by pressing the letter f.
Manual assignment: selecting ports with bypass from the available ports listed will be displayed in the process of creating segments.

section.title: Creating a new segment and assignment of port
section.para: To illustrate this process we will create a segment (segment 0) and will assign 2 ports.
To begin the process of creating the segment, select n in the lateral submenu right of the screen.
Once you have reviewed the ports available, select the one you want to assign to the segment as it appears at the bottom of the previous screen.
Enter the number that will give the segment on the line Insert segment number (0-15) [0]:_
The number in brackets [] is the one that defines the system default. To select this number, press Enter.
The port previously assigned to the segment will disappear from the list of available ports.

note.title: Note
note.para: The system only allows the creation of up to 16 segments (0-15).

section.title: Add a second port segment
section.para: Once the first port is assigned to the segment, the system will make it possible to assign a second port to the segment: Assign second port to the segment (Y/n):_
The option that is predetermined by default is capitalized.
Remember that if you want to assign a new port you only have to press the Enter key.

If you don’t want to assign a new port, typen. Once you have reviewed the ports that are available, select the one you would like to assign to a segment as shown at the bottom margin of the previous screen.
Enter the port number in the line Insert segment second port [3]: _
Once you have assigned the two ports to a segment, the system will let you know that the segment has been created properly Segment 0 created successfully.

section.title: Finish the process of creating segments
section.para: Before applying changes and finalizing the process of creating the segment, a screen will be displayed with a list containing the following elements:

listitem.para: Segments
Ports assigned to the segment
Whether or not you have bypass interfaces

section.para: In order for modifications to remain saved you must perform the action to apply changes by selecting option a.
You can delete the created segments at any time by entering the letter delete segment, insertando la letra d.
To return to Network Settings in the main menu, select the quit option by entering q.

section.title: Appliances managed via IPMI
section.para: In the case that the user provided an appliance managed through an IPMI system, you will have the ability to insert the corresponding IP to IPMI in your system so you can connect to the sensor using IPMI.
In the Network Settings menu select optionIPMI Network configuration wizard entering the number 4.
To finish the network configuration process, you must perform the action to apply changes: apply, by selecting optiona.
You can view the IPMI settings at any time by selecting the option info by entering the letter i.
To apply changes, the system will finish performing the configurations necessary to begin the registration of sensors.

section.title: Sensor registration in Manager
section.para: To complete the installation of the IPS sensors, the last step that must be performed is the Registration of sensors in Manager.
Until the registration has been completed, a message will be displayed indicating that the sensors are not yet registered in Manager.
In the menu of registered sensors in Manager, the following are included:

listitem.para: Hostame [rbsensor]: set name to sensor.
Set local time: set local time.
IP adress for rB Master Manager [127.0.0.1]:enter the IP Manager.
Register rB: registration of the sensors in the Sensor Manager / Manager. Until the registration process has been completed, the user will see a message displayed in red: (not registered yet)

section.title: Set name to sensor (Hostname)
section.para: Select the Hostname [rbsensor] from the Sensor Registration menu in Manager by entering the number 1.

Then in the line Insert Hostname [rbsensor]:_ write the name you want to give the sensor to be registered with the Manager. From this moment, this is the name displayed on the web when you access the list of IPS sensors.

note.title: Note
note.para: Remember to enter a different name for the sensor. Avoid using the name "Sensor", since it is the generic name used by the Manager and that could ultimately cause confusion.

warning.title: Caution
warning.para: The system will ask you to verify that the chosen name is correct, then press Enter
To modify insert the letter n
the system will proceed to rename the sensor. To continue and to return to the redBorder menu setup system, Press a key to continue..._

section.title: Set local time
section.para: Select the option Set local time found in the Sensor Registration settings in Manager by entering the number 2.
This should correspond to your selection you made in basic settings for the configuration process of IPS sensors.
The system will show you two possible formats for inserting the date and time (Y=year):

listitem.para: [HH:mm] or [YYYY/MM/DD]

section.para: Press Enter to continue the registration process.

section.title: Enter the IP of Master Manager
section.para: Select the option IP adress for rB Master Manager [127.0.0.1] by entering the number 3.
First, insert the IP address or domain name for the manager. The system will perform a series of checks to verify if the action can be accomplished. This process can take a few seconds.
The system will synchronize the time service.
Congratulations! Your system is prepared for sensor registration in Manager.
To continue, and return to the redBorder System Setup menu, Press a key to continue..._

section.title: Sensor registration in Manager
section.para: This is the last step for finishing the installation process of the redBorder IPS solution.
From this point you can work directly from the IPS management application, in which your dashboard graphically displays all traffic events captured by the IPS sensors.
In this application you can create reports, view events or set the rules of the Manager including actions.

para.emphasis: Completion of the sensor registration process in Manager:

section.para: Here are the following steps to complete the sensor registration process in Manager:

listitem.para: Indicate whether you want to have a debug output: the system will prompt you with the question: Would you like to have a debug output? Select the default (No) by inserting the letter N.
Insert password: specify the password you entered the Manager.
Time synchronization (automatic) between the Manager and sensors: this process may take a few seconds to complete.

section.para: After performing these steps, the system will prompt you with a message that the sensor has been successfully registered. Sensor registered successfully with chef server

para.literal: Sensor registered succesfully with chef server

warning.title: Caution
warning.para: Do not rename the sensor orhostname once it has been registered. To make changes to the hostname it is necessary to undo the entire registration process and start over.

section.para: To continue and return to the redBorder setup menu system, Press a key to continue..._
In the Sensor Registration menu in Manager, redBorder can verify that the sensor has been successfully (Registered).
To exit the Sensor Registration wizard in Manager, select quit by entering q.

section.title: Welcome to redBorder IPS
section.para: Congratulations! You have successfully completed the installation of the redBorder IPS solution. From this point you can easily operate from the interface of the application.
The next screen will display the sensors whose names match the given names in step Set name to sensor or (Hostname).
